public interface Database
extends SettingsBackedObject

Database of objects.

beginWrites

boolean beginWrites()
Begins a series of writes. Note that for every call of this method, there must be a matching endWrites() call, so a typical use would look like: 

 try {
     database.beginWrites();
     ...
     database.commitWrites(); // Or commitWritesEventually();
 } finally {
     database.endWrites();
 }

Returns:
false if called within another nested transaction.

beginIsolatedWrites

void beginIsolatedWrites()

commitWrites

boolean commitWrites()
Commits all pending writes. The data will either be saved, or discarded if there are any validation errors.

Returns:
false if called within another nested transaction.
Throws:
IllegalStateException - If called without a preceding call to beginWrites().

commitWritesEventually

boolean commitWritesEventually()
Commits all pending writes to be available for read eventually. If this method is used to write to the database, subsequent read to the saved data may not be available immediately.

Returns:
false if called within another nested transaction.
Throws:
IllegalStateException - If called without a preceding call to beginWrites().

endWrites

boolean endWrites()
Ends the series of writes.

Returns:
false if called within another nested transaction.
Throws:
IllegalStateException - If called without a preceding call to beginWrites().

void save(State state)
Saves the given state.
